contactUtilizationMethod: Hold one narrow end of the ruler like a utensil; tap/stab the far end downward.

expectedHapticFeedback: Use Fork to fork the cut pieces of steak. When piercing the steak, users should feel a noticeable penetration distance with progressive resistance.
harmony_explanation: Pot is easy to hit and soil allows several centimetres of progressive penetration, giving reliable contact whenever visual spearing occurs.
expressivity_explanation: Damp soil allows several centimetres of progressive penetration with increasing resistance, resembling the feel of spearing steak. Grainy texture and friction variations are transmitted through the stiff ruler, providing moderate expressivity, though lack of fork-like prongs and ruler’s bluntness limit realism.
realism_explanation: Soil allows a few centimetres of progressive penetration with moderate resistance, partially mimicking piercing meat. Granular crumble lacks the fibrous yield of steak, and the textural feedback is earth-like rather than meaty, but the depth and graded force profile give a passable approximation.

realism_explanation: Pages simply separate with negligible resistance, producing a sliding rather than puncturing feel. There is no tearing and almost no progressive force build-up, so the haptic profile is unlike sinking tines into steak.
